results.title: V160777 (Chocos)
results.creator_credit: Bill Goodes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When he signed up as a conscript, Bill Goodes was given the number V160777 and the label Choco. He knew it was given to the conscripts that, like him, fought in New Guinea, but he had no idea what it meant, though he did sense the connotation was negative. He reflects on how he fought like any other soldier, for three years without a break. In New Guinea, he was just like everyone else. But when he returned to Australia to take up life as a dairy farmer, he soon realised that some people just saw him as a Choco. For Bill, none of this has detracted from his contribution to the war effort.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Goodes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: I'm a fool
results.creator_credit: Noel Black, Dan McCann and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
This adaptation of Sherwood Anderson’s short story tells of a few milestones in the life of an adolescent boy who, at the turn of the century, left home and attempted to make a life of his own. Stars Ron Howard.

results.title: The Green mountain of bamboo = Zhu shan qing qing
results.creator_credit: Zhu Er, Hu Shu'e and Xiaoxiang Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Set in the early 1980s in a small village in south China, The Green Mountain of Bamboo tells the story of how a young woman stands up to oppose an arranged marriage by her father and eventually finds true love. Mr. Qin has two sons and a daughter who are all grown-ups now. The elder son is about to get married, which cost Mr. Qin a fortune. Mr. Qin listens to the matchmaker’s advice and wants his daughter to marry a young man from a well-off family. However, Qin’s daughter, Li Mei, is already in love with another man, Li Shangyou, whose family is quite poor. Li Mei asks her father to give Shangyou a chance, who promises to Qin that he will prepare enough money in three months to marry his daughter. Li Mei, Shangyou and Shangyou’s mother all work hard day and night to make money for the marriage. Just by the time they had the money ready, Shangyou’s mother fell sick but refused to use the money for her illness. Li Mei is moved and determined to marry Shangyou. However, Li Mei’s father severely blames his daughter and forces her to marry the other man. Li Mei seeks support from the director of the Women’s Association, who firmly stands on Li Mei’s side. At Qin’s elder son’s wedding banquet, Li Mei disappears. Shangyou’s mother finds a scarf of Li Mei and sends it to Qin, who is shocked and thought his daughter must have died. Qin regrets for what he did. However, it turned out that Li Mei didn’t die but went to marry Shangyou with the support of the Women’s Association.

Xiaoxiang Film Studio was established in 1958 when Chinese cinema was nationalized with the help of Soviet Union’s experts. Formerly known as Hunan Film Studio, it changed to the current name in 1980. The film was made in the early 1980s when the economic reform was launched and a “Thought Liberation” movement swept the whole country. This film can be understood as a politically-oriented film in the sense that it delivers a clear message to its audience that arranged marriage and mercenary marriage represent the feudal ideas and should be condemned. (2 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)

results.title: Convoy of life
results.creator_credit: Doss Jenkins, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Doss Jenkins’ driving instructor was not fond of female drivers and was strict but she passed and soon became part of a long convoy transporting American goods over Australia. The journey was a gruelling and hot 108 weeks on the road, travelling at 50km an hour. Doss reflects on the things that kept her going, the games she played and the friends she made. This group of ladies still have an annual reunion due to the strong bond created by the journey.

results.title: The Green hornet. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Ray Taylor, Ford Beebe and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Volume 2 contains chapters 7 to 13. Based on the successful radio serial of the same name, Britt Reid (Gordon Jones) as the Green Hornet and his crime fighting partner, Kato (Keye Luke) battle against organised crime’s king-pins. The Green Hornet is the direct descendant of the famous masked crime fighter, The Lone Ranger. He’s the Lone Ranger’s grand nephew. This movie serial used the same principle characters that featured in the radio play as well as the famous Hornet musical signature (Flight of the Bumble Bee) and gadgetry such as a gas gun to incapacitate criminals. Also used is the voice of Al Hodge, the radio Green Hornet, which was heard when crusading publisher Britt Reid spoke from behind the Hornet mask. Also stars Anne Nagel as Lenore Case.

results.title: Come on Bushy
results.creator_credit: Bill Bush, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Bill Bush joined the army for a bit of adventure and to escape troubles at home. He fought in Korea, where his skills as a paramedic were also utilised. He continued this work into civilian life. With a mantra of doing what you were told, without complaint, Bill ultimately leads a happy life doing what he loves.

results.title: Broken China: the earthquake that never happened
results.creator_credit: Qi Kejun, Xue Song, Liu Chun, Lin Xiezhong, Wei Bin, Yu Bo, Zhao Shujing, Chen Meng, Yuan Zhengming, ABC-TV (Australia), Southern Star Entertainment and CCTV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Dragon stirs”.
Part one of a four part series about China. On 28 July 1976 a natural disaster - the worst ever recorded in China - killed over a quarter million people in the industrial city of Tang Shang, just 100km east of Beijing. An earthquake of massive proportions ripped the city apart destroying 96% of its buildings and burying alive over 600,000 people, all within 53 seconds. Fearing political unrest with the imminent death of Chairman Mao, the Chinese Government kept the extent of the disaster a State secret rejecting international offers of help preferring instead to send in thousands of their own soldiers from the People’s Liberation Army. This documentary records the amazing effort by the soldiers and the people of Tang Shang to rebuild their city in the aftermath of the earthquake. Through personal interviews by survivors and their stories of heroic acts, miracles, and tragedies, the film provides an insight into the spirit, unity and courage of these people who 20 years on still carry the memories and emotional scars. It is a heart-warming story of humans co-operating together as one in the most adverse of circumstances. Contains b&w archival footage. Narrated by Peter George and Diana McLean. In Mandarin with English subtitles and commentary in English.
results.title_for_label: Broken China: the earthquake that never happened
results.creator_credit_for_label: Qi Kejun, Xue Song, Liu Chun, Lin Xiezhong, Wei Bin, Yu Bo, Zhao Shujing, Chen Meng, Yuan Zhengming, ABC-TV (Australia), Southern Star Entertainment and CCTV

results.title: The Great New Zealand Fishing Safari
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Action Downunder”.
Geoff Thomas and his guests travel throughout New Zealand in search of the best fishing. He and his guests journey to some of New Zealand’s most spectacular locations in search of striped marlin, rainbow trout, mako sharks, snapper and many more. One in a series of films which capture some of the world’s most exciting fishing action.
